turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hey, I'm really struggling to stick to my grocery budget this week. Can you help me figure out a shopping list that's affordable?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Hello! I can certainly assist you with that. To give you the best recommendations, could you please tell me your budget for the week and approximately how many people you are shopping for? Any dietary preferences or restrictions would also be helpful!

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, thanks. My budget is pretty tight, just $40 for the whole week for me and my partner. It feels impossible sometimes! We're not picky, honestly, just need to make it work.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Understood, a $40 budget for two people for a week requires careful planning, but it's definitely achievable! Focus on inexpensive staples like rice, beans, lentils, pasta, potatoes, and seasonal produce. Look for sales on proteins like eggs or chicken leg quarters. Planning meals around versatile ingredients is key.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Right, staples are good, I get that. But how do I actually find out what's *cheap* right now? Like, is chicken cheaper than ground beef this week? Do I have to check every single store flyer? It just feels overwhelming trying to compare everything.
